paper_abstract: Given two subsets S-1, S-2 of N-k, we say that S-1 is commutatively equivalent to S-2 if there exists a bijection f : S-1 -> S-2 from S-1 onto S-2 such that, for every v is an element of S-1, vertical bar v vertical bar = vertical bar f(v)vertical bar, where vertical bar v vertical bar denotes the sum of the components of v. We prove that every semi-linear set of N-k is commutatively equivalent to a recognizable subset of N-k. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the commutative equivalence of semi-linear Sets of N-k
